ref: 1563 itkaṭa -- , ikkaṭa -- m. ʻ a kind of reed or grass ʼ lex. 2. utkaṭa -- 1 m. ʻ Saccharum sara or similar grass ʼ Suśr., ʻ fragrant bark of Laurus cassia ʼ, ˚ṭā -- f. ʻ the plant ʼ lex.
Pk. ikkaḍa -- m. ʻ a sort of grass ʼ;
S. ikaṛa f. ʻ wild bush whose leaves are used as a vegetable ʼ;
A. ikrā ʻ a kind of reed ʼ;
B. ikaṛ ʻ a reed ʼ, ikṛā ʻ a kind of plant ʼ;
Or. iṅkaṛa, iṅkara, iṅgaṛa ʻ a reed like sugar -- cane from which pens are made ʼ;
Bi. ikkar, ikrī ʻ a kind of grass ʼ;
Si. ikili ʻ the plant Acanthus ilicifolius ʼ, ikiliya ʻ the waterplant Trapa bispinosa ʼ, ikiri ʻ the plant Barleria ʼ.
